title: Economic Development: Theories and Frameworks
description: This course reviews the evolution and foundations of contemporary economic development.  It offers a critical appraisal of approaches and frameworks that are adopted to understand and analyze economic development processes at different geographic scales.

title: Analytical Tools for Economic Development
description: The course provides an overview and hands-on application of the quantitative analytical methods regularly used by professionals in economic development and related fields.  Emerging analytical tools and techniques are explored.

title: Economic Development: Policy and Practice
description: This course exposes students to the spectrum of contemporary economic development policies and practices enacted at the local, regional and national scales by a range of public, private and not-for-profit agencies.  Policies and practices are evaluated in terms of the trade-offs between efficiency, equity and sustainability goals, as well as their short- and long-term impacts and outcomes.
